title: UniClean
details:
- Developed a full-stack cross-platform mobile application as a final year project to address menstrual health issues and period poverty.
- Implemented a Long Short-Term Memory (LSTM) model to predict the length of the luteal phase in regular and irregular menstrual cycles, enabling timely medical attention to prevent miscarriages and infertility and implementing a real-time trained medical chat assistant specifically for such issues.
- Integrated a personalised reminder system that notifies members of academic institutions about the availability of free period products on campuses, based on their individual menstrual cycles, to overcome period product poverty.

title: Subspace
details:
- Developed a full-stack, cross-platform application as a personal project to streamline the management of online subscriptions, providing a centralised solution with timely reminders and an interactive dashboard.
- incorporated real-time features, such as push notifications and automatic subscription renewal reminders, to enhance user experience and prevent unintended lapses or cancellations.
- Implemented a robust backend using Supabase that ensures data privacy, security, and compliance.

title: Flatify
details:
- Led a team of seven in developing a cross-platform application for a global corporation to streamline the process of locating accommodations for their consultants.
- Designed and implemented features that allowed consultants to easily search for and connect with suitable accommodations, fostering meaningful connections among the company's global workforce.
- Utilized agile methodologies throughout the 12-week project to adapt dynamically to emerging requirements, ensuring collaboration, transparency, and innovation within the team.
- Awarded the Best Software Engineering Award for successfully delivering a user-centered solution that enhanced the company's operational efficiency and consultant experience.

title: Ro-Reviews
details:
- Developed a user-friendly website as a personal project using Next.js for book enthusiasts to track and manage their book collections, featuring a clean and modern design that makes it easy to navigate and organise books.
- Implemented a robust note-taking system that allows users to add, edit, and delete notes for each book, providing a seamless experience for users to record their thoughts, opinions, and insights about the books they read.
- Utilised Next.js's server-side rendering capabilities to ensure fast and efficient loading of the website, ensuring a smooth user experience for users who want to quickly access and manage their book collections.

title: RoamCast
details:
- Collaborated on a graphical user interface application as a group project in 2nd year, designed to help tourists plan their trips based on real-time weather forecasts and access all the necessary information related to their destination in one centralised platform.
- Implemented a user-friendly interface that allows tourists to easily search for their desired destination, view detailed weather forecasts, and access relevant information such as local attractions, restaurants, transportation options, and accommodation recommendations.
- Focused on Human-Computer Interaction principle whilst enhancing the application's usability, intuitive navigation, and overall user experience.

title: HART News
details:
- Led a web-based news application project for a final year module on Web Programming, utilising Django for a scalable backend architecture and MySQL for efficient data storage and retrieval; integrated RESTful APIs to fetch and display news articles in JSON format dynamically.
- Implemented secure user authentication and session management using web cookies and tokens, enhancing web security and user experience;
- Deployed the application on OpenShift for scalable cloud hosting and used AWS S3 to host multimedia content, optimising storage and enhancing content delivery for a global user base.
